body:
@bhargav-sudo You should replace the `<config.json>` phrase with the actual path to the config file you created.
Also if you are using as the `base_path` the folder `/model_server/models/`, you need to mount the models folder also with such path `-v /models:/model_server/models/`.

Hi @dtrawins  

docker run --rm -d  -v /models/**:/opt/ml:ro** -p 9001:9001 -p 8001:8001  **-v <config.json>:/opt/ml/config.json** openvino/model_server:latest \
**--config_path /opt/ml/config.json** --port 9001 --rest_port 8001

can you explain this command.? Particularly the bold text part in the command.
I am totally confused using this command..

Thanks..

@bhargav-sudo good reading about mounting volumes in docker containers is in https://docs.docker.com/storage/volumes/
`-v` option is mapping the filesystem path from the host to the filesystem in the docker container. After the docker image name, there are ovms parameters used inside the container. It means those parameters refer to the filesystem inside the container. While you create the configuration file for ovms, you need to pass it to the container via `-v` command. In the command above the phrase  `<config.json>` must be replace with the actual file path to the configuration file on the host. In the container it will be mapped to `/opt/ml/config.json` path. I hope it helps.

@bhargav-sudo I see a mistake in your docker command. You missed mapping the config path to the container. It should be like :
`docker run --rm -v /models/:/model_server/models/ -p 9001:9001 -p 8001:8001 -v /model_server/config.json:/model_server/config.json openvino/model_server:latest --config_path /model_server/config.json --port 9001 --rest_port 8001`
A basic example of the application reading the video stream from cameras is in https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/model_server/blob/main/example_client/multi_inputs.py 
It reads the frames from the cameras or a video file and submit them to OVMS for inference processing.

Thanks @dtrawins for the video Instructions will try that too after this..

But I used above your command 

**docker run --rm -v /models/:/model_server/models/ -p 9001:9001 -p 8001:8001 -v /model_server/config.json:/model_server/config.json openvino/model_server:latest --config_path /model_server/config.json --port 9001 --rest_port 8001**

It shows same error.
**[2021-02-03 12:11:07.135][modelmanager][error][modelmanager.cpp:395] Configuration file is not a valid JSON file.
[2021-02-03 12:11:07.135][modelmanager][error][modelmanager.cpp:60] Couldn't start model manager
[2021-02-03 12:11:07.135][serving][error][server.cpp:175] ovms::ModelManager::Start() Error: The file is not valid json**

Thanks.

I checked your JSON config file snippet from above online (e.g. "https://jsonformatter.curiousconcept.com/") and the syntax looks fine.
Maybe the file has a wrong file ending (Linux-file-ending, Windows-file-ending), or your real file contains invisible whitespaces (trailing or leading whitespaces)?
Or there are multiple config-files and you took another one accidently than you thought?

@bhargav-sudo  double check if the right file is stored in /model_server/config.json. Probably it is not the right one or it has some json syntax error. My observation is also the in the config file, each model should have different `base_path` like /model_server/models/face-detection and /model_server/models/person-detection.
